moves.3. a3: White does not continue Queen's Gambit...
moves.5. Nf3 Nc6 6. g3 Bg4: Normal developement for Black, White does not move pawns E-D?
moves.7. Bg2 Bd6 8. O-O O-O 9. Re1: Finally prepearing to move E-D pawn!
moves.10... Nxe4 11. h3: This weakens pawns in front of the king...
moves.11... Bh5: Let's see if white moves g4 in order to weak even more the pawns
moves.14... Bg6 15. g5 Qf5: It is interesting the b8-h2 diagonal controlled by black
moves.19... Nd4: Black prepares the attack. After ...,Rxe1; Qxe1,Kf3 and Black gains the Queen: the Bishop is the problem, how to make it inoffensive?
moves.20. Be4 Qh3: The Queen can enter White defense without any problem: now the King cannot move anymore
moves.21. Bxb7:
White is too much hungry. White does not see the menace ...,Rxe1.
Now the Bishop is too far away in the Black field, it could be trapped!!
moves.21... c6: Black leaves there the Rook and traps the Bishop!!! The idea is to sacrifice the rook in order to make inactive the Bishop.
moves.22. Bxa8:
White is too hungry.. 

22.Bxc6, Kxc6 and White loose a piece but it permits to alleviate pression over the king.
Now the Black attack can start!
moves.22... Rxe1+: No move is possible for the King.
